trans-unit.source: Represents system information regarding a SOAP message header.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaderInfo"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the intended recipient of the message header.
If this property is empty, the header is interpreted as targeted for the ultimate recipient of the message.
A URI that indicates the intended recipient of the message header.
Gets a value that specifies whether the message header represents reference parameters of an endpoint reference.
A reference parameter corresponds to the <`ReferenceParameters`> element described in the in the [WS-Addressing specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96163).
`true` if the message header represents reference parameters of an endpoint reference; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether processing the message header is mandatory or optional.
If this property is `true` and the message receiver cannot interpret the message header, the message is not processed and an exception is thrown.
If this property is `false`, the receiver can ignore the message header and continue processing.
`true` if processing the message header is mandatory; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the name of the message header.
The name of the message header.
Gets the namespace of the message header.
The namespace of the message header.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the message header can be relayed.

The SOAP specification defines a header block as one that can be relayed in the forwarded message if the header block is targeted at a role acted on by the SOAP intermediary, but not otherwise processed by the intermediary.
`true` if the message header can be relayed; otherwise, `false`.
